question: The National Health Authority (NHA) has signed an agreement with which ride-haling app for transporting healthcare workers involved in treatment of covid-19 patients?
explanation:
The National Health Authority (NHA) has signed an agreement with the ride-haling app Uber, for providing transport services to healthcare workers involved in treatment of covid-19 patients
Through its UberMedic service, the ride-hailing firm is to provide 150 cars free of cost to support medical facilities in certain cities. This initiative comes at the back-drop of the lock-down, where all forms of public and private transportation have been restricted. Hygiene measures such as roof-to-floor plastic sheeting enclosing the driverâ€™s seat and disinfecting the car are ensured in every ride.
